column1: The plates of a capacitor are charged to a potential difference of 5 V. If the capacitance is 2 mF, what is the charge on the positive plate?

A sphere, a cube, and a cylinder, all of equal mass, are released from rest from the top of a short incline. The surface of the incline is extremely slick, so much so that the objects do not rotate when released, but rather slide with negligible friction. Which reaches the base of the incline first?
column5: All reach the base at the same time.

column1: If two non-zero vectors are added together, and the resultant vector is zero, what must be true of the two vectors?
column2: They have equal magnitude and are pointed in the same direction.
column3: They have equal magnitude and are pointed in opposite directions.
column4: They have different magnitudes and are pointed in opposite directions.
column5: It is not possible for the sum of two non-zero vectors to be zero.

column1: An object is released from rest and falls a distance h during the first second of time. How far will it fall during the next second of time?

A rubber ball (mass = 0.08 kg) is dropped from a height of 3.2 m, and after bouncing off the floor, rises almost to its original height. If the impact time with the floor is measured to be 0.04 s, what average force did the floor exert on the ball?

A cannon is mounted on a truck that moves forward at a speed of 5 m/s. The operator wants to launch a ball from a cannon so the ball goes as far as possible before hitting the level surface. The muzzle velocity of the cannon is 50 m/s. At what angle from the horizontal should the operator point the cannon?
The Space Shuttle orbits 300 km above the Earth’s surface; the Earth’s radius is 6400 km. What is the acceleration due to Earth’s gravity experienced by the Space Shuttle?

A block is dragged along a table and experiences a frictional force, f, that opposes its movement. The force exerted on the block by the table is
column5: neither parallel nor perpendicular to the table

column1: How much work is required to charge a 10 µF capacitor to a potential difference of 100 V ?
A bi-convex lens has a radius of curvature of magnitude 20 cm. Which of the following best describes the image formed of an object of height 2 cm placed 30 cm from the lens?

A car rounds a banked curve of uniform radius. Three forces act on the car: a friction force between the tires and the road, the normal force from the road, and the weight of the car. Which provides the centripetal force which keeps the car in circular motion?
column5: a combination of the normal force and the friction force

column1: An elevator is rising. In order to determine the tension in the cables pulling it, which values (for the elevator) would you need to know?

Two objects, A and B, have equal charge and equal mass. Neither body is in motion because the gravitational and electrostatic forces between them are equal. If the mass of Object A is halved, equilibrium will be maintained if
column2: the charge on Object A were doubled
column3: the charge on Object B were halved
column4: the charge on Object B were doubled
column5: the mass on Object B were halved

column1: A particle's kinetic energy is changing at a rate of –6.0 J/s when its speed is 3.0 m/s. What is the magnitude of the force on the particle at this moment?
Which of the following types of electromagnetic radiation has the longest wavelength?
The weight of a box on the Earth is 80 N. What is the weight of the box on the moon if the moon has 1/80th the mass and 1/4th the radius of the Earth?
Experimenter A uses a very small test charge qo, and experimenter B uses a test charge 2qo to measure an electric field produced by two parallel plates. A finds a field that is
column2: greater than the field found by B
column3: the same as the field found by B
column4: less than the field found by B
column5: either greater or less than the field found by B, depending on the accelerations of the test charges

column1: A car moving with speed v reaches the foot of an incline of angle θ. The car coasts up the incline without using the engine. Neglecting friction and air resistance, which of the following is correct about the magnitude of the car’s horizontal acceleration ax and vertical acceleration ay?
A confined ideal gas undergoes a cyclical process in three steps—an isobaric step, followed by an isochoric step, followed by an isothermal step. Which of the following must be true?
column2: The change in internal energy of the gas is equal to the work done during the isobaric step.
column3: The change in internal energy of the gas is equal to the work done during the isobaric step minus the work done during the isothermal step.
column4: The total work done during the cycle is positive.
column5: The total work done during the cycle is equal but opposite to the net amount of heat transferred.
